lead_paragraph: GREASON--Mary Twomey. The entire Marymount Manhattan College community mourns the loss of Mary Twomey Greason. Mary Twomey Greason graduated magna cum laude from Marymount Manhattan College in 1986 with a Bachelor of Arts in art history and went on to a life of service for the College. Mary encouraged alumni to become involved and give back to the college, and demonstrated tremendous generosity and leadership in her work on the Board of Trustees from 1995 to 2004 and again from 2005 to 2014. She lit up every room she entered and was a friend to all. Mary's commitment to Marymount Manhattan and her dedication to the college's students, faculty, and staff will always be remembered. Services: visitation at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home, 1076 Madison Ave., New York, NY, Tuesday, January 12th from 3:00-5:00pm and 7:00-9:00pm. Funeral Mass at 11:00am on Wednesday, January 13th, at Our Lady of Peace Church, East 62nd St. between Second and Third Avenues. In lieu of flowers, the family has suggested contributions to the Mary Twomey Greason Endowed Scholarship at Marymount Manhattan College. Kerry Walk, Ph.D., President, Marymount Manhattan College Hope Knight, Chairperson of the Board of Trustees, Marymount Manhattan College 1/3
